content.raw: Originally this function was called every time generate\_objects, which is used when generating a str. This meant that the values would change every time it was outputted. This caused a problem because the expression `'%s' % w` will call \_\_str\_ twice when w is unicode in python 2, as is the case here. This expression is called in the template.substitute method of str, used by us to print out all our param values. It seemed best to have a constructor store the data in a class variable that could be accessed any time, rather than only have it correct the first time.
content.html: Originally this function was called every time generate_objects, which is used when generating a str. This meant that the values would change every time it was outputted. This caused a problem because the expression '%s' % w will call __str_ twice when w is unicode in python 2, as is the case here. This expression is called in the template.substitute method of str, used by us to print out all our param values. It seemed best to have a constructor store the data in a class variable that could be accessed any time, rather than only have it correct the first time.
